title: Welcome address at IJCAI 2011

author: Toby Walsh, NICTA, Australia's ICT Research Centre of Excellence
Andreu Mas-Colell, Department of Economics and Business, Pompeu Fabra University

segmentation: So just a quick word about the submissions.
We had 1325 submissions from 59 countries.
Both those systex are records, of which we selected 17% of those for to be presented as talks and posters, and another 13%.
Just as as posters, I'd like to point to you that the proceedings available online you gotta see Diino CDs are going out.
We we felt we had to give you something, but I suspect most of you going to access them.
Online using using the web and another innovation is I've organized.
Doi's will be registered for all of the papers in the proceedings, and it's our ambition to ensure that DOI is registered for all the back catalog in India.
Of course as well.
I promised you a few statistics about where submissions came from.
I think this this pie chart actually quite surprised me when I put the statistics into the into the into PowerPoint.
Most of our submissions in fact, almost twice almost exactly twice that of any region came out of Europe.
Europe is definitely a powerhouse for AI, and then another statistic that surprised me was the 2nd place did not go to North America but went to Asia.
We had a large number of submissions from China from Japan from Hong Kong, Singapore and India, and a few other countries in Asia and Southeast Asia.
So then America came.
On the heels of those two, at 20%.
Broken down by country.
You see this wonderful power law graph.
Not surprisingly, actually, the country with the most emissions with the United States.
There's a few countries that I wanted to bring your.
To your attention, so I've colored them in for you.
In place with China.
I think that helps justify the decision that the next edition of each guy is going to be going to China.

It's a rapidly developing field in science and in artificial intelligence as well, and I was very pleased to see the Halo effect of having an inch guy in a country like Spain that third place shortly for the first time ever was taken by Spain, which was able to Pip France.
The powerhouses like France.
How many in the United Kingdom?
So that was wonderful to see the impact that having each guy in a country like this has, and I think goes to support the discussion that's going on now about whether we should move.
It is key to a greater frequency so that we could actually go and do that in other countries.
And a few other countries that caught my attention.
Brazil, which as many of you know, is one of the bidders for for hosting and one of the countries in South America that I think many people would like to go and visit at one point.
And also as you see next to Brazil this India.
So I think there's a perhaps still a bit of a honeymoon effect from having had an edge chi in India.
Not so not so long ago, and I just point you, this is all the countries that had more than five submissions.
And at the alphabetically at the furthest right on your screen, you see an interesting development, which is Iran appearing there, and I'm sure that's only going to increase.
